intro: Lychnis lagrangei, commonly known as the Lagrange’s campion, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Its flowers are pink to red in color, with five petals and prominent stamens. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, facilitating its spread in suitable environments.
